intro: Hieracium eichvaldii, commonly known as the Eichvald's hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Europe and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a single, terminal capitulum. Hieracium eichvaldii is a perennial herb that is often found in disturbed or open areas.
